newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ABN plans New York listing, share split.
newsitem.headline: ABN plans New York listing, share split.

text.p: Dutch bank ABN AMRO Holding NV said on Thursday it planned a listing of its shares in the form of American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) on the New York Stock Exchange.
It said it would buy back one percent of its own shares for this purpose which would be reoffered to to U.S. investors.
ABN AMRO said it also planned a four-for-one split of its ordinary shares.

"The managing board has decided...to propose to the general meeting of shareholders a split of the ordinary shares of NLG 5 face value into four ordinary shares of NLG 1.25 face value," ABN AMRO said in a statement accompanying its 1996 results.

"ABN AMRO intends to list its ordinary shares on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in the form of American Depositary Receipts," it said. "In connection with the NYSE listing, ABN AMRO will purchase approximately one percent of the ordinary shares outstanding from one or more parties for re-offer to U.S. investors." The share split and NYSE listing are expected to take effect in May, it added.
